ovdesc.p: AZ ALL INE ONE SCHEDULES HIST FILE AZ.SCHEDULES.HIST All in One Account module enables the Banks to define Account based Loan and Deposit products. The loan/ deposit accounts opened under this module, based on a pre defined All in One Products, are different from the Contract based Loans and Deposits, in view of flexibility in operations, like a normal account. The schedules are for the purpose of reference only, and no actions are automatically performed by the system based on the schedules. Schedules are used for updating the limit, ADI and comparing the AZ account balance on scheduled dates, to arrive at the arrears or the redraw value. The file AZ.SCHEDULES is generated by the system automatically, based on the definitions given in AZ.ACCOUNT. Changes in Principal amount, Rate of interest, Term, or Frequency may result in Re scheduling, based on the value of Term Priority opted by the user, in AZ.ACCOUNT. Whenever, an existing schedule is rescheduled by opting the Term Priority, as explained above, the revised schedule is written in AZ.SCHEDULES and the previous schedule is written in AZ.SCHEDULES.HIST with a note explaining the reason for the Reschedule. A combination of AZ account number, date of reschedule and serial number is defined as the ID for AZ.SCHEDULES.HIST
AZ. SCHEDULES. HIST DATE. RESCH Contains past data on those loan accounts where RESCHEDULING have been allowed with respect to term, amount or rate.
AZ. ACCOUNT with a RESCHEDULING should have existed in the live file.

AZ. SCHEDULES. HIST EXCEEDS. TOLERANCE This field holds the HISTORICAL data of instances wherein EXCEEDS. TOLERANCE has been activated owing to the tolerance levels indicated in the field LIAB. TO.PENALTY (field in APP) in case of deposits and from GRACE. PERIOD (field in APP) field in case of loans being exceeded.

AZ. SCHEDULES. HIST LAST. PAY. DATE Stores past data on deposits with B schedules payment dates for future references. This information stored in this History file is drawn from file LAST. PAY. DATE of AZ. SCHEDULES.

AZ. SCHEDULES. HIST NEW. AMOUNT Once the Loan a/c is closed -the historical data about the amount of drawn down and the date of such draw downs are stored in this AZ. SCHEDULES. HIST file for future references.

AZ. SCHEDULES. HIST NOTES:- The field contains the historical record of VARIOUS stages that the AZ account has passed through before it is finally closed. For ex. An FD input on say 14.05.2001 for say 2 million Stage -(1)Partly redeemed for 1 million on 15.05.2001 Stage-(2) On 17.05.2001 may be rolled over further period of 2 days Stage-(3)On 19.05.2001 when the deposit is closed by transferring the balance to nominated a/c In the above the notes will contain the following :- Stage (1) "Early redemption of 1 million on 15.05.2001" Stage(2) "Deposit rolled over" and Stage (3)"Closed contract"

AZ. SCHEDULES. HIST AMOUNT. DUE When B schedules for Deposits and P schedules for loan are defined- on the designated dates the system will look for balance in the REPAY a/c for appropriating the above scheduled amounts. In case a lesser balance exists than what is actually needed - the system will appropriate the balance available and write the difference amount in the field AMOUNT. DUE. Subsequently when the AMOUNT. DUE is collected - this is written to HISTORY (under AZ. SCHEDULES. HIST) for future references.
Specifies the Date on which the Principal/ or its portion is drawn down
No input field Standard T24 date format Part of Multi value set.

desc.p: AZ. SCHEDULES. HIST NOTES:- The field contains the historical record of VARIOUS stages that the AZ account has passed through before it is finally closed. For ex. An FD input on say 14.05.2001 for say 2 million Stage -(1)Partly redeemed for 1 million on 15.05.2001 Stage-(2) On 17.05.2001 may be rolled over further period of 2 days Stage-(3)On 19.05.2001 when the deposit is closed by transferring the balance to nominated a/c In the above the notes will contain the following :- Stage (1) "Early redemption of 1 million on 15.05.2001" Stage(2) "Deposit rolled over" and Stage (3)"Closed contract"

AZ. SCHEDULES. HIST LAST. PAY. DATE Stores past data on deposits with B schedules payment dates for future references. This information stored in this History file is drawn from file LAST. PAY. DATE of AZ. SCHEDULES.

AZ. SCHEDULES. HIST NEW. AMOUNT Once the Loan a/c is closed -the historical data about the amount of drawn down and the date of such draw downs are stored in this AZ. SCHEDULES. HIST file for future references.
AZ. SCHEDULES. HIST DATE. RESCH Contains past data on those loan accounts where RESCHEDULING have been allowed with respect to term, amount or rate.
AZ. ACCOUNT with a RESCHEDULING should have existed in the live file.

AZ. SCHEDULES. HIST EXCEEDS. TOLERANCE This field holds the HISTORICAL data of instances wherein EXCEEDS. TOLERANCE has been activated owing to the tolerance levels indicated in the field LIAB. TO.PENALTY (field in APP) in case of deposits and from GRACE. PERIOD (field in APP) field in case of loans being exceeded.
Specifies the Date on which the Principal/ or its portion is drawn down
No input field Standard T24 date format Part of Multi value set.

AZ. SCHEDULES. HIST AMOUNT. DUE When B schedules for Deposits and P schedules for loan are defined- on the designated dates the system will look for balance in the REPAY a/c for appropriating the above scheduled amounts. In case a lesser balance exists than what is actually needed - the system will appropriate the balance available and write the difference amount in the field AMOUNT. DUE. Subsequently when the AMOUNT. DUE is collected - this is written to HISTORY (under AZ. SCHEDULES. HIST) for future references.
